result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David L. Mijal

records.addlTxt: DEOJ Agreement
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Approving DEOJ
Re: Order Approving DEOJ

Case called: 8:53 a.m.
Clerk: Nicole.      
State appears by ADA Hannah Runde; Defendant appears w/Atty Zachary Glascock;

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to;
COUNT 1: (Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm)>>AMEND to (Disorderly Conduct)
COURT grants above;
PLEA: 
COUNT 1 (Disorderly Conduct)>>NO CONTEST.
COUNT 2 (Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse)>>NO CONTEST.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 1 year for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to COUNT 1 AMEND to 9.21 DISORDERLY CONDUCT. COUNT 2 DISMISS.

DEOJ RH>> 10/10/23 at 1:10 p.m.
Bond continues.
 
Adjourned: 9:08 a.m.
ATTIC DV-VIP Acceptance
ATTIC DV-VIP Acceptance
Plea hearing on October 18, 2022 at 08:45 am.

records.addlTxt: PTC held; Future dates set;
Pre-trial conference on September 15, 2022 at 10:50 am.

AMENDED.  No violent or abusive contact with S.M.T.M or children; not to engage in corporal punishment of any children; must abide by any condition imposed by the Dept. of Social Services regarding children.  Police (Wausau PD) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 1:42 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett in person. Defendant appears in person with Atty Zachary Glasscock.
Date and time set for a motion to modify bond.
VRCW. 

ADA Barnett does not have objections to lifting the no contact with the spouse and the non victim children, but does object to contact with child victim O.D.M.
Atty Glascock makes arguments.
Victim S.M.M. makes statement. 
COURT addresses parties.
COURT amends bond to delete no contact provision with the victims, with the exception of: No violent or abusive contact; not to engage in corporal punishment of any children; must abide by any condition imposed by the Dept of SS regarding the children. 

Dates to remain.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): S.M.T.M. or victim's children.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police (Wausau PD) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
